member.name: MIBICMPSTATS
member.summary: TheMIBICMPSTATS structure contains statistics for either incoming or outgoing Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages on a particular computer.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwMsgs
member.summary: The number of messages received or sent.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwErrors
member.summary: The number of errors received or sent.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwDestUnreachs
member.summary: The number of destination-unreachable messages received or sent. A destination-unreachable message is sent to the originating computer when a datagram fails to reach its intended destination.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwTimeExcds
member.summary: The number of time-to-live (TTL) exceeded messages received or sent. A time-to-live exceeded message is sent to the originating computer when a datagram is discarded because the number of routers it has passed through exceeds its time-to-live value.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwParmProbs
member.summary: The number of parameter-problem messages received or sent. A parameter-problem message is sent to the originating computer when a router or host detects an error in a datagram's IP header.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwSrcQuenchs
member.summary: The number of source quench messages received or sent. A source quench request is sent to a computer to request that it reduce its rate of packet transmission.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwRedirects
member.summary: The number of redirect messages received or sent. A redirect message is sent to the originating computer when a better route is discovered for a datagram sent by that computer.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwEchos
member.summary: The number of echo requests received or sent. An echo request causes the receiving computer to send an echo reply message back to the originating computer.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwEchoReps
member.summary: The number of echo replies received or sent. A computer sends an echo reply in response to receiving an echo request message.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwTimestamps
member.summary: The number of time-stamp requests received or sent. A time-stamp request causes the receiving computer to send a time-stamp reply back to the originating computer.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwTimestampReps
member.summary: The number of time-stamp replies received or sent. A computer sends a time-stamp reply in response to receiving a time-stamp request. Routers can use time-stamp requests and replies to measure the transmission speed of datagrams on a network.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwAddrMasks
member.summary: The number of address mask requests received or sent. A computer sends an address mask request to determine the number of bits in the subnet mask for its local subnet.

member.name: MIBICMPSTATS.dwAddrMaskReps
member.summary: The number of address mask responses received or sent. A computer sends an address mask response in response to an address mask request.
